description: AI copilot for electronics design
job_description_detailed:
Here is the extracted information related to the job description:

**Job Title:** Lead Principal Engineer

**Job Summary:** 
The company is seeking a hands-on Lead Principal Engineer to lead the software engineering efforts at SnapMagic, reporting directly to the CEO. The role involves driving product velocity and satisfaction, ensuring the delivery of world-class products for electrical engineers.

**Responsibilities:**

**Technical Development:**

* Own all software developed and maintained by the company
* Code, troubleshoot, and design architecture across the stack
* Identify and address infrastructure challenges
* Work collaboratively to plan and execute sprints
* Manage and mentor developers
* Write or review technical specs as needed
* Track, analyze, and improve engineering metrics
* Create an environment of continuous improvement and excellence
* Recruit and assess new candidates for the team

**Management:**

* Recruit, onboard, and develop a high-performing engineering team
* Foster a culture of collaboration, mentorship, and continuous improvement
* Drive performance through KPIs, OKRs, and sprint planning
* Serve as the primary point of contact for all software engineering efforts

**Long-term planning:**

* Proactively identify and mitigate software challenges to ensure reliability and scalability
* Own the roadmap for current and future infrastructure and architecture needs
* Collaborate cross-functionally to align engineering initiatives with business goals

**Requirements:**

* 5+ years of software engineering experience with a strong track record of building robust applications
* 5+ years of management experience, leading and scaling engineering teams
* Expertise in back-end development, with proficiency in Python, Django, and PostgreSQL
* Proficiency in front-end frameworks like Vue or React and experience with RESTful APIs and microservices
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (Heroku, Azure, AWS) and database management
* Experience designing scalable architectures and solving complex infrastructure issues

**Nice to Haves:**

* Experience with desktop application development
* Familiarity with AI tech stacks and computer-aided design software
* Background in electronic circuit design or electrical engineering

**Perks and Benefits:**

* Competitive compensation packages
* Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage
* 401k plan
* Hybrid work environment with in-person collaboration three days a week
* Catered lunches
* Opportunities for career growth and significant impact on a groundbreaking product
* A culture of innovation and creativity

job_description_detailed:
Based on the provided HTML, I've extracted the information related to the job description:

**Job Title:** SWE Intern

**Job Requirements:**

* High-functioning SWE interns
* Excited about solving unsolved problems
* Ship code like 10X SWEs on adderall
* Happy to travel across the US on a moment’s notice to visit users
* Excited to live in a 120 year old victorian mansion, consume copious amounts of steak and creatine, not smoke/drink, and participate in mandatory cold plunges in the SF bay with a handful of bros
* Interested in working in/founding startups
* Studying CS/AI in college at a school that has a well-regarded program
* Has built and shipped a product to real users on their own OR has impressive hackathon placements
* Did AI/CS research (this is a plus)

**Job Benefits:**

* Perks: Housing, food, gym, supplements, housekeeping, and travel covered
* Work: extreme ownership, hard problems, large opportunity for high-paying job offer
* Culture: operate like Navy Seals

**Company Information:**

* The company is building AI agents to replace law firm staff, starting with an inbound sales team.
* The company has received $3m in seed funding within 72 hours.
* The company is led by Ethan Hilton (CEO), Ayushman Srivastava (Head of AI), and Tolen Schreid (CTO).

job_description_detailed:
Based on the provided HTML, I've extracted the information related to the job description:

**Job Title:** Founding Engineer (not explicitly mentioned, but implied as "Sphinx's first founding engineer")

**Job Summary:**

* Work directly with the founders to shape the future of the company
* Make key technical decisions, build the product, and help assemble a team of A-players
* Take the lead on one of two big endeavors: a Generalizable Robotic Process Automation (RPA) Agent or a Knowledge Graph of All the Bad People in the World

**Responsibilities:**

* Build ML systems from notebook to AWS
* Work on one of the two projects:
	+ Generalizable Robotic Process Automation (RPA) Agent:
		- Operating in an industry where mistakes cost a minimum of $250k
		- Think Claude Computer Use, but better
	+ Knowledge Graph of All the Bad People in the World:
		- Leveraging LLMs, graph databases, and website-agnostic scraping
		- Built to handle millions of pages per day at scale

**Requirements:**

* No ego: Company > team > self
* Love working hard: This isn’t a “chill” job – it will be intense, demanding, and incredibly rewarding
* Speedy coder: You love complex problems and designing the simplest solution for them
* Client-Driven: We don’t code in the dark. Everything we build is 100% based on client need
* Ownership: You don’t wait for permission – you see problems, solve them, and own the outcome

**Tech Stack:**

* Python
* LLMs
* VLMs
* Traditional ML
* Django
* Docker
* Postgres
* AWS

I was an operator of a $100MM DTC ecomm company and ran revenue growth data science for a $10B public SaaS company. I'm passionate about building high performing teams and continuously learning.

founders.bio: Co-Founder of Voker, the Self-Serve AI Builder for Product Teams

job_description_detailed:
Based on the provided HTML, I extracted the following information related to the job description:

**Job Title:** Founding Full Stack AI Software Engineer

**Job Summary:**
The job involves playing a key role in the development of Voker's platform, working alongside the CTO and core team to build out the technology stack and deliver customer-driven AI solutions.

**Responsibilities:**

* Develop robust features to production with proper architecture, testing, and design
* Care about the end customer's pains and want to know how your code is impacting them

**Requirements:**

* Must currently be located in Los Angeles to apply
* Must have at least 1 year of experience as a Senior Software Engineer and 4+ years of experience engineering in total
* Must have 2 years of experience developing AI applications with Large Language Models (LLMs) and systems such as retrieval-based methods, fine-tuning, or agent-based architectures
* Must have experience with AI frameworks like Langchain, Llama Index, OpenAI, or similar tools
* Desire to work in person, next to CTO, CEO, and engineering team 6 days a week
* Experience with: Svelte, Python, TypeScript, Postgres
* Enthusiastic about the challenges and opportunities of working at a very early startup
* Someone who enjoys being a part of a small, tight-knit team where your contributions will directly impact the success of the company

**Nice to Have:**

* Experience deploying, monitoring, and maintaining large language models (LLMs) models in production
* Previous startup experience

description: The AI co-pilot for sales reps at industrial wholesale distributors.

founders.name: Jason Sullivan
founders.bio:
Jason is the founder and CEO of Distro, the all-in-one AI co-pilot for counter staff and inside sales at industrial wholesale distributors. He is a repeat founder, having previously co-founded Vested. Before Vested, he was CTO at Elementus, Tech Lead at Coatue, and Senior Software Engineer at PeerIQ. In a prior life, Jason was a credit derivatives trader.

Jason holds an MS in Computer Science from Stanford and a BA in Cognitive Science from Yale.

description: AI agents for mortgage servicing

founders.name: Rishi Choudhary
founders.bio:
Rishi is the co-founder and CEO of Kastle (www.kastle.ai)

Before Kastle, Rishi was the founding Product Manager for Redfin’s Mortgage Marketplace at age 22 and grew the business from $3M to $6M in revenue in 9 months. He also led Redfin's Search Experience team responsible for 80% of the company's traffic. 

Rishi has a BS in Systems Engineering from the University of Illinois at Urbana Champaign. At UIUC, Rishi ran the largest US student consulting club with 250 students and $500K ARR

founders.name: Nitish Poddar
founders.bio: Nitish is the co-founder and CTO of Kastle (kastle.ai). Before Kastle, Nitish was a tech lead at Verkada, where he led development for a patented motion search system and built out the entire backend inference infrastructure. He also led the firmware delivery team on a new fleet management system and led engineering for Incident Management, Verkada's newest product line. Nitish graduated from UIUC with a degree in Computer Science.

job_description_detailed:
Based on the provided HTML, I extracted the following information related to the job description:

**Job Title:** Founding Engineer at Kastle

**Job Type:** Backend Engineer

**Job Summary:**

* Build and optimize Kastle's AI infrastructure
* Architect and scale AI systems, ensuring high availability, low latency, and compliance with strict financial regulations
* Work closely with the founding team to design, develop, and deploy mission-critical AI applications that integrate with financial institutions

**Responsibilities:**

* Architect and develop scalable backend services for AI-driven mortgage servicing applications
* Design and implement APIs that integrate with loan servicing platforms, payment processors, and compliance systems
* Optimize performance for real-time AI interactions, ensuring sub-700ms latency
* Manage containerized deployments using Kubernetes to maintain high availability and reliability
* Develop event-driven architectures using Python AsyncIO for parallel processing and real-time automation
* Ensure security and compliance with financial regulations (SOC 2, FDCPA, RESPA, TILA)
* Own the full development lifecycle—from designing scalable solutions to deploying and monitoring them in production

**Minimum Requirements:**

* 1+ years of backend engineering experience in high-velocity environments
* Expertise in Python, with strong knowledge of AsyncIO, FastAPI, or Django
* Experience with containerization and orchestration tools, including Docker and Kubernetes
* Proficiency in designing and optimizing distributed systems, with a focus on high-availability architectures
* Familiarity with event-driven architectures and message queues (e.g., Kafka, RabbitMQ, or Redis Streams)
* Strong database skills, including PostgreSQL or other relational/NoSQL databases
* Knowledge of API security best practices (OAuth, JWT, rate-limiting)
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps tools
* Excellent problem-solving skills and a passion for optimizing backend performance

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Background in AI/ML-powered systems, especially LLM applications
* Experience working with financial services or compliance-heavy industries (fintech, lending, insurance)
* Previous startup experience, with a hands-on approach to problem-solving

founders.bio: Nitish is the co-founder and CTO of Kastle (kastle.ai). job_description_detailed:
Here is the extracted information related to the job description:

**Job Title:** Founding Applied AI Engineer at Kastle

**Job Summary:**
As a Founding Applied AI Engineer, you will integrate advanced AI technologies into Kastle's platform, working on fine-tuning large language models, designing AI workflows for highly regulated enterprises, and ensuring AI agents deliver precise, compliant, and effective interactions.

**Responsibilities:**

1. **AI Model Integration:** Fine-tune and deploy LLMs for real-time borrower interactions.
2. **Prompt Engineering:** Design, test, and iterate on prompts to optimize AI performance and compliance.
3. **Custom AI Solutions:** Train and implement domain-specific AI models for mortgage servicing.
4. **Scalability & Compliance:** Ensure AI solutions meet regulatory standards (FDCPA, RESPA, TILA) and scale efficiently.
5. **Data Pipelines & APIs:** Build robust AI-driven workflows that integrate seamlessly with loan servicing platforms.
6. **Continuous Optimization:** Monitor AI performance, reduce error rates, and enhance borrower experience.

**Requirements:**

1. 3+ years in applied AI, ML engineering, or a related role.
2. Proficiency in Python, TensorFlow/PyTorch, and deep learning frameworks.
3. Experience fine-tuning LLMs (Llama, GPT) and designing AI prompt workflows.
4. Strong product mindset—ability to bridge AI capabilities with real-world mortgage servicing needs.
5. Understanding of mortgage regulations (or willingness to learn) to ensure AI compliance.
6. Experience with deploying AI models into production and optimizing for speed and accuracy.
7. Strong communication skills to collaborate with product, engineering, and compliance teams.

**What the Company Offers:**

1. Be part of a fast-growing AI startup shaping the future of financial services.
2. Work on cutting-edge AI technologies solving high-impact problems.
3. Collaborate with a top-tier team backed by leading investors.
4. Competitive salary, early-stage equity, and ownership over AI strategy.

description: The AI workforce for medical groups

founders.name: Aumesh Misra
founders.bio: Co-founder and CTO of Tivara. I've spent 4 years building software at Microsoft and Compound (YC S19). I was the 8th engineer at Compound and helped grow the company to over $2B AUM. Prior to this, I researched and developed software for novel medical imaging devices at Stanford.

founders.name: Tej Seelamsetty
founders.bio:
Founder and CEO of Tivara.

I started my entrepreneurship journey at 18 years old: As soon as I could sign a personal guarantee, I started flipping houses to (successfully) pay for college. Building software to automate the tedious aspects of my own due diligence opened my eyes to the magic of code. Since then, I led growth (10x-ed revenue) at Fair Square (W20) and worked as a consultant at Bain. I studied computer science and financial engineering at WashU.

description: IDE to develop, iterate and deploy AI Agents

founders.name: Robert Chandler
founders.bio:
Robert Chandler is a founder & CTO at Wordware. 

He started his career as an early engineer at a self-driving car startup, Five AI, which was acquired by Bosch. Here he lead the Offline Perception team which accelerated the dev-test cycle through automated ground truthing and was awarded 5+ patents in the process.

He has been in the AI space for over a decade since studying Information Engineering at the University of Cambridge.

founders.name: Filip Kozera
founders.bio:
Cofounder and CEO at Wordware -- an IDE for Natural Language Programming and Agent Orchestration. Previously I cofounded and exited KRISTALIC, which tried to augment the human memory. Before that, I studied Deep Learning at Cambridge. 

The most interesting fact about me outside of work is that I travelled to 103 countries and was part of multiple high-altitude mountaineering expeditions and rescue operations in Kyrgyzstan and Nepal. I also do sailing, paragliding, kitesurfing and boxing.

job_description_detailed:
After carefully analyzing the provided HTML, I've extracted the information related to the job description:

**Job Summary:**

* Build the foundation of an AI development platform used by hundreds of thousands of builders
* Craft code that shapes an entire industry

**Responsibilities:**

* Architecting important features
* Writing a significant amount of code (mostly TypeScript/Next.js)
* Maintaining the stack (AWS/Cloudflare)
* Troubleshooting and communicating with users when issues arise
* Making product decisions on the fly
* Solving complex problems

**Requirements:**

* 4+ years of experience building real products used by real people
* Comfortable with the company's tech stack (TypeScript/Next.js, AWS/Cloudflare)
* Experience with AI development (an "AI engineer")
* Ability to fix issues without being asked
* User-centric approach (caring more about users than code)
* Bonus points for founder/CTO experience

**Work Environment:**

* San Francisco only
* Fast-paced startup environment with a lot of work
* Meals provided at the office
* Shipping to production from day one
* Sometimes building features without full specs
* Occasional UX decisions when designers/founders are busy
* Code will impact hundreds of thousands of developers
* Crossbow competitions (yes, you read that right!)

**Ideal Candidate:**

* Has built complex projects from scratch
* Wants to fix developer tools
* Wants to shape how AI is built

**Company Information:**

* Backed by Spark Capital, Felicis, and Y Combinator ($30m seed)
* Works like a seed startup despite funding
* Office will have a sauna and be 30m from the sea

job_description_detailed:
Based on the provided HTML, I've extracted the information related to the job description:

**Job Summary:**

* The company is looking for someone to show 500 million people that coding with plain English is the future.
* The ideal candidate will build demos, create content, and help shape the explore page into GitHub for AI.

**Job Challenges:**

* Explaining the new programming paradigm based on natural language to traditional developers and the next wave of AI builders.
* Bridging the gap between these two groups.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Building killer demos and examples
* Shaping the explore page
* Creating technical content

**Requirements:**

* Be a developer who loves to teach
* Have real experience with LLMs and AI
* Understand RAG, agents, and prompt engineering
* Know how to make complex demos simple
* Be comfortable on camera and stage
* Actually enjoy talking to people

**Bonus Points:**

* Previous devrel experience
* Content creation background
* Open source contributions
* Experience building communities

**Work Environment:**

* SF only - no remote
* You'll be one of the faces of Wordware
* Lots of context switching between coding and communication
* You need to understand the product deeply
* Your demos will be used by hundreds of thousands of people
* Weird company culture, with crossbow competitions on Sundays and a sauna in the office

**Ideal Candidate:**

* Has built demos that made developers excited
* Has explained complex tech in simple ways
* Wants to shape how people learn AI
* Has dreamed of building GitHub for AI

**Job Title:** Full Stack Engineer

**Job Requirements:**

* Strong experience with Python or Go
* Hands-on experience training ML models, building chatbots, or using AI APIs
* Expertise in web scraping and automation tools
* Proficiency in React and Next.js
* Experience deploying on AWS, GCP, or DigitalOcean, with Docker skills and the ability to set up databases and queues (e.g., Redis, RabbitMQ)

description: AI call centers

founders.name: Will Bodewes
founders.bio:
Will Bodewes is the co-founder and CEO of Phonely. 

Prior to starting Phonely, he was pursuing a PhD at the University of Melbourne researching applied artificial intelligence applications.  Before that, he founded an audio-tech startup that garnished celebrity engagement from Chance the Rapper, the band ASIA and more. During college, he competed in the NCAA's for XC skiing, and was one of the top ultra-endurance cyclists in the world.

founders.name: Nisal Ranasinghe
founders.bio: Nisal is the Co-founder and CTO of Phonely. With a background in Electronic and Telecommunications Engineering, he worked as a senior engineer in the AI team of a major telecommunications company for nearly three years, where he led projects on advanced AI solutions. Nisal then pursued a PhD at the University of Melbourne, focusing on explainable AI and AI for healthcare.

job_description_detailed:
Based on the provided HTML, I've extracted the information related to the job description:

**Job Title:** Senior Backend Engineer

**Location:** San Francisco (or willing to relocate)

**Job Description:**

* **What You Will Do:**
	+ Build and scale real-time AI systems by designing and deploying highly scalable backend services.
	+ Optimize performance and reliability by improving logging, monitoring, and telemetry (Datadog or similar).
	+ Deploy and maintain AI systems in production with robust deployment pipelines and CI/CD automation.
	+ Work with LLMs and OpenAI APIs, especially asynchronous API handling.
	+ Improve system resilience through containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), distributed systems, and NoSQL databases.
* **Competencies:**
	+ 3+ years of experience running production systems and building deployment pipelines.
	+ Strong knowledge of Kubernetes, cloud infrastructure (GCP preferred), and CI/CD automation.
	+ Experience working with Python backend engineering, LLMs, and real-time AI systems.
	+ Ability to optimize for high availability, performance, and cost efficiency.
	+ Bonus: Experience in voice AI and/or hyper-growth startup environments.

**Tech Stack:**

* Core Technologies: Python, Next.js, TypeScript
* AI Tools: OpenAI, Llama 3, Anthropic, Speech-to-Text, Text-to-Speech
* Infrastructure: GCP, Kubernetes, Datadog

**Who Should Apply:**

* You have experience working in high-growth startups and thrive in fast-paced environments.
* You take ownership and get things done without waiting for direction.
* You have a strong technical background and are eager to work on cutting-edge AI.
* You want to shape the future of real-time AI-powered voice interactions.
* You're willing to work 12+ hours and love every minute of it.

**Call to Action:** Apply now and help build the next generation of voice AI at Phonely.

job_description_detailed:
Based on the provided HTML, I extracted the following information related to the job description:

**Job Title:** Founding Engineer

**Location:** San Francisco (or willing to relocate)

**Job Summary:**

* The company is looking for a founding engineer with DevOps experience to help them move fast, iterate quickly, and scale effectively.
* The ideal candidate loves building from scratch and thrives in high-growth environments.

**Responsibilities:**

* Deploy and manage production voice AI agents
* Design, build, and deploy voice AI agents to the cloud with fast iteration cycles
* Ship pre-defined monitoring goals within the first 14 days
* Develop independent monitoring solutions within the first 30 days
* Optimize and automate infrastructure to ensure scalable and reliable deployments
* Continuously improve the platform's resilience, implementing solutions like multi-cluster rollovers and auto-scaling for performance spikes

**Competencies:**

* Experience with Kubernetes, GCP, or other distributed systems tools
* Hands-on experience working with LLMs (bonus points if you've worked with voice AI solutions)
* Clear communication and collaboration skills
* Ability to work in uncertain, fast-changing environments and understand what it takes to thrive at an early-stage company

**Qualifications:**

* Background in ex-founder/CTO, Infrastructure, or DevOps Engineering
* 1+ years of experience at a company with fewer than 100 employees
* 5+ years of total engineering experience
* 2+ years focused on infrastructure or DevOps

**Nice to Have:**

* Experience as a founder or founding engineer
* Understanding of work-life balance
* Familiarity with tools like Cursor, Zed, and code-generation technologies
* Insight into LLM limitations and excitement about future model evolution
* Experience working closely with customers to iterate fast and build products that solve real problems
* Ability to think independently, get things done, and maintain high standards
* Experience building real-time systems in industries like Telecom, Autonomous Vehicles, or High-Frequency Trading

**Tech Stack:**

* Core Technologies: Next.js, TypeScript, Python, Tailwind
* AI Tools: Llama 3, OpenAI, Anthropic, STT, TTS
* Infrastructure: GCP, Kubernetes (k8)

**Why Join Us:**

* Opportunity to work on cutting-edge voice AI technology at a rapidly scaling company
* Chance to be part of a hyper-growth startup, build meaningful technology, and shape the future of voice AI interactions.

description: Find & resolve issues in data center engineering & operations using AI

founders.name: Shapol M
founders.bio: Co-founder & CEO at Entangl.

founders.name: Antanas Zilinskas
founders.bio: Co-founder and CTO at Entangl.

job_description_detailed:
Here is the extracted information related to the job description:

**Job Title:** Deployment Software Engineer

**Job Summary:**
As a Deployment Software Engineer at entangl, you will design, develop, and deploy custom software solutions that bridge the gap between the engineering team and clients, translating real-world challenges into scalable, robust software deployments.

**Key Responsibilities:**

1. **Customer Engagement & Discovery:**
	* Go onsite to meet with client teams to identify critical operational challenges and data needs.
	* Collaborate with customer analysts to prioritize key problems that need solving.
2. **Solution Design & Development:**
	* Work closely with Forward Deployed Engineers and cross-functional teams to architect and implement robust data integration pipelines.
	* Develop customized software components and workflows that are both stable and extensible to meet evolving customer requirements.
3. **Implementation & Deployment:**
	* Integrate complex datasets into cohesive systems that drive actionable insights.
	* Build and deliver compelling demos and prototypes that illustrate how our solutions can transform business processes.
	* Lead training sessions with end users to ensure successful adoption and tangible impact on their operations.
4. **Feedback & Continuous Improvement:**
	* Collect and analyze customer feedback to drive iterative improvements in our deployments.
	* Share field insights with our Software Engineering and Product Design teams to enhance entangl’s overall product offerings.
5. **Strategic Contribution:**
	* Help scope out new engagement opportunities across diverse industries and geographies.
	* Present deployment outcomes and proposals to stakeholders ranging from technical teams to C-suite executives.

Let me know if you'd like me to extract any other information!

founders.name: Ian Laffey
founders.bio: GPS-denied nav for drones

founders.name: Sacha Levy
founders.bio: UAV nav in gps denied environments.

founders.name: Carl Schoeller
founders.bio: Building Theseus – defense systems independent of GPS. Before that designed and built around 2000 unique parts. Some of those are in mass production on Tesla Cybertruck and some in an Apple product.

job_description_detailed:
Based on the provided HTML, I've extracted the information related to the job description:

**Job Title:** Founding Engineer

**Job Summary:**

* Join the team as a Founding Engineer with expertise in embedded engineering and robotics localization
* Work on cutting-edge, time-sensitive problems with real-world impact
* Shape the future of Theseus and grow with the company as it scales

**Responsibilities:**

* Lead the development and optimization of the visual navigation system
* Design, test, and implement embedded software with a focus on vision-based robotics
* Make key decisions around system architecture, balancing execution risk, lead time, and cost
* Work closely with vendors and suppliers to ensure performance of hardware components
* Drive fleet management strategies, overseeing QA for large deployments and proactively addressing issues that arise in the field

**Requirements:**

* Over one year of experience in embedded hardware, including over one year working on systems that involve cameras or VIO (Visual Inertial Odometry)
* Proficient in writing embedded C++ code, troubleshooting both hardware and software issues
* Demonstrated ability to balance technical trade-offs (SWAP, cost, lead time) and develop solutions that prioritize scalability and cost-efficiency
* Experience managing fleets of robotic systems, leading QA efforts, and working directly with vendors to troubleshoot and ensure system reliability

**Nice to Have's:**

* Experience working with drones or other autonomous aerial vehicles
* Experience working with the ArduPilot ecosystem
* Previous experience in a startup environment or building something from the ground up

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary and equity package
* Opportunity to be part of the founding team, with direct influence over product and company direction
* Comprehensive health benefits
* Office in San Francisco with easy CalTrain / I280 access

job_description_detailed:
Here is the extracted information related to the job description:

**Job Title:** Founding Embedded Software Engineer

**Job Summary:** Design, implement, and maintain the core embedded software and systems infrastructure for the VPS (Visual Positioning System) for autonomous drone localization in contested environments.

**Responsibilities:**

* Design, implement, and optimize software for resource-constrained hardware
* Integrate sensors and autopilot interfaces into unified data pipelines
* Configure and maintain logging frameworks, system daemons, and networking protocols
* Develop fail-safe logic, error handling, and fallback strategies for mission-critical operations
* Make key decisions around system architecture
* Work with QA, perception/SLAM teams, and hardware vendors to unify system architecture

**Requirements:**

* 2+ years professional experience in software engineering (professional or OSS) working with C++/Rust
* Ability to isolate and fix non-trivial hardware/software integration issues using instrumentation and systematic testing

**Nice to Have's:**

* Experience working with vision-based systems
* Experience implementing and troubleshooting embedded communication protocols (e.g., TCP/UDP, UART) in production environments
* Experience with cross-compilation, Docker-based builds, automated test frameworks, and CI/CD for ARM or similar SBCs
* UAV/robotics background (PX4, Ardupilot)
* Startup experience scaling hardware products

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary and equity package
* Opportunity to be part of the founding team, with direct influence over product and company direction
* Comprehensive health benefits
* Office in San Francisco with easy CalTrain / I280 access

founders.name: Soo Yung Cho
founders.bio: Sooyung is the co-founder and CTO of Powder, AI sales copilot for wealth advisors. Prior to founding Powder, Sooyung was a founding team member of RCI which was acquired by Addepar in 2021. Sooyung graduated from Johns Hopkins with a BS degree in Computer Science. Out of work, he enjoys playing lacrosse.

founders.name: David Goerz
founders.bio:
Co-founder & Chief Investment Officer for Powder Finance, which is building an AI Sales co-Pilot for wealth advisors to automate gathering financial holdings, analyze portfolios, assess risk tolerance, and summarize data to engage faster and efficiently.

He managed portfolio strategies for institutional asset owners for 33 yrs on mandates up to $30B in assets with pioneering innovations in quantitative equity and return forecasting, optimization and risk management. Chair, Investment Committees

founders.name: Kanishk Parashar
founders.bio: cofounder/CEO Powder - AI growth platform for wealth advisors.  Previously, I was cofounder/CEO of RCI Navigator.  Navigator helps asset and wealth managers to pace into private assets such as VC, PE, Infra, etc. while taking risks into account.  It was acquired by Addepar in Jan 2021.  Navigator is used by 150+ firms including UBS and Morgan Stanley.  Before that I was cofounder/CEO of Coin (YCW13).  Coin was a all-in-one digital credit card that combined all your cards into one.

founders.name: Dominic Tully
founders.bio: I am currently the co-founder and Head of Sales and Operations at Powder. Prior to Powder, I work at the fintech firm, Addepar, as both a Senior Account Executive and Senior Account Manager. I started my career at Goldman Sachs, where I worked in the Private Wealth Management division in San Francisco.

job_description_detailed:
Based on the provided HTML, I extracted the following information related to the job description:

**Job Summary:**
We are looking for a motivated candidate who is excited to thrive in a fast-paced startup environment and committed to relentlessly supporting our objectives. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining both the front-end and back-end components of our software applications.

**Key Responsibilities:**

1. Design, develop, and maintain end-to-end software solutions, including both front-end and back-end components.
2. Collaborate with product managers, designers, and other developers to define project requirements and deliver high-quality features.
3. Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code, following best practices and coding standards.
4. Troubleshoot, debug, and resolve software defects and performance issues.
5. Stay up-to-date with emerging trends and technologies in software development and apply them to improve our products.
6. Participate in all phases of the software development lifecycle, including planning, design, implementation, testing, and deployment.
7. Contribute to the continuous improvement of our development processes and tools.

**Requirements:**

1. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
2. Minimum 4 years of experience as a Full Stack Developer or similar role.
3. Proficiency in modern front-end technologies like React, Angular, or Vue.js.
4. Strong experience with back-end technologies such as Node.js, Python, Ruby, or Java.
5. Familiarity with relational database management systems such as Postgres and MySQL.
6. Knowledge of cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
7. Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
8. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
9. Experience with AI platforms and technologies, including generative AI models and LLMs is a plus.

**Job Title:** Founding Engineer

**Job Summary:**

* Join a YC-backed company driving AI adoption within physical commodity trading
* Work closely with the founding team to shape the future of the product and company
* Take ownership, drive initiatives, and make smart decisions that align with the realities of a startup environment

**Responsibilities:**

* Provide technical leadership
* Work across all parts of the product
* Make decisions, own features, and help drive tech and product forward
* Make intelligent trade-offs and decisions that balance short-term needs with long-term goals
* Take ownership, drive initiatives, and make smart decisions

**Requirements:**

* 4+ years of experience in software engineering with a proven track record of exceptional work
* Outstanding coding skills and the ability to quickly master new languages or frameworks
* Familiarity with tools and technologies like React, TypeScript, Go, Java, Mongo, Node, SQL, and Python is a plus
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to make data-driven decisions and offer clear, strategic recommendations

Before joining ByteDance/TikTok, Bing founded two investor-backed startups in college, generating six-figure revenues.

**Good to Haves:**

* Proficiency in AWS, cloud deployment, CI/CD
* Usage of React 19 + Next.js 15
* Experience with ORMs (Prisma, Drizzle, etc)
* Strong foundational understanding of communications protocols (HTTP, WebRTC, WebSockets) and telephony systems
* Experience with micro-service based architecture & building robust, flexible systems
* Machine learning research experience
* Previous startup experience

**Personal Qualities:**

* Resourceful
* Resilient
* Decisive
* Likes difficult problems
* Fun

**NSFABIQ (Not So Frequently Asked But Important Questions):**

* Why should I join Brainbase and not start my own startup?
* I'd like to join, but I don't think I'm founding engineer material
* What's the application process like?

**Application Process:**

* Screening phone call
* Technical screen (take home or over Zoom)
* Paid trial for a week at the offices

description: AI workflow automations for enterprise

founders.name: Gokhan Egri
founders.bio:
Freeing up your company's workforce by automating repetitive data tasks at Brainbase (W24).

Previously Co-founder and CEO at Leo (AI grader), Harvard CS PhD (dropped-out).

job_description_detailed:
Based on the provided HTML, I extracted the following information related to the job description:

**Job Title:** Solutions Engineer

**Job Summary:**

* Ensure the success of enterprise customers as they deploy Brainbase at scale
* Hands-on, customer-facing role requiring technical expertise, resourcefulness, excellent communication skills, and comfort under pressure
* Oversee custom deployments for various customers, build custom integrations, and communicate customer feedback to the team

**Responsibilities:**

* Customize Brainbase for diverse use cases
* Build custom integrations
* Perform prompt engineering
* Talk to prospective, new, and existing customers
* Communicate customer feedback to the team
* Work directly with the engineering team and CEO
* Work closely with partners and sales team as their technical point of contact

**Requirements:**

**Must Haves:**

* US work permit (no H1-B sponsorship, OPTs are fine)
* Excellent communication skills
* Excellence in NodeJS, Python, and Typescript
* Comfortable working full-stack
* Previous experience in a customer-facing role
* Some experience with LLMs (OpenAI API, Langchain, HuggingFace, etc.)
* Demonstration of autonomy and entrepreneurial spirit (side projects, previous companies, software consulting)

**Good to Haves:**

* Proficiency in AWS, cloud deployment, CI/CD
* Experience with micro-service based architecture
* Machine learning research experience
* Previous experience in a customer-facing engineering/deployment role
* Previous startup experience

**Personal Qualities:**

* Resourceful
* Resilient
* Decisive
* Likes difficult problems
* Fun

Let me know if you'd like me to extract any other information from the HTML!
